question.title: Threads in Waiting state - Apache Tomcat

node.contents: Are all the other threads stuck at the same place? This thread dump is showing only one thread.

astNode.text: Are all the other threads stuck at the same place? This thread dump is showing only one thread.

node.contents: We have deployed our Remedy mid-tier on Tomcat 6.0.20, however Tomcat goes down very frequently, almost every day, with the following error :

astNode.text: We have deployed our Remedy mid-tier on Tomcat 6.0.20, however Tomcat goes down very frequently, almost every day, with the following error :

node.contents: Maximum number of threads (400) created for address null and port 8080

astNode.text: Maximum number of threads (400) created for address null and port 8080

node.contents: We have tried increasing the the number of threads, but it just does not suffice. The time difference between 2 subsequent crashes just increases, but it is the same problem.

astNode.text: We have tried increasing the the number of threads, but it just does not suffice. The time difference between 2 subsequent crashes just increases, but it is the same problem.

node.contents: We have obtained the thread dump, and it shows that most of the threads are in 'Waiting' state. Please refer below obtained from thread logs as follows:

astNode.text: We have obtained the thread dump, and it shows that most of the threads are in 'Waiting' state. Please refer below obtained from thread logs as follows:

node.contents: There are many reasons for the threads being in 'Waiting', can anyone help to narrow down.

astNode.text: There are many reasons for the threads being in 'Waiting', can anyone help to narrow down.

node.contents: The threads appear to be waiting but in fact they are blocked inside a working queue. Looks like they use a ThreadPoolExecutor to schedule tasks but there is not enough threads in the working queue to process all the tasks, or each task is taking too long.

astNode.text: The threads appear to be waiting but in fact they are blocked inside a working queue. Looks like they use a ThreadPoolExecutor to schedule tasks but there is not enough threads in the working queue to process all the tasks, or each task is taking too long.

node.contents: Also, inspect the PoolingProxyManager, what is he getProxy supposed to do, it looks like it is trying to get connection or some other resource.

astNode.text: Also, inspect the PoolingProxyManager, what is he getProxy supposed to do, it looks like it is trying to get connection or some other resource.
